speaker: SAM
line: Fox! Wake up. Fox!

speaker: MULDER
line: Samantha?

speaker: SAM
line: Shh. They'll hear you.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: No! My baby!

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I'm afraid, Fox. I'm afraid.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what time is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It'S ALMOST 5:00 AM. Is something wrong?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I'm in a... a motel room in Providence, but...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: MULDER
line: Rhode Island.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing there?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. There's... t-there's blood all over me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you hurt, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think so. I don't think it's my blood.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder? Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't get warm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're in shock. Dry yourself off. I'll get you a blanket. Do you feel sick? Nauseous or dizzy?

speaker: MULDER
line: N-no, but I, uh... I woke up on the floor with a pounding headache.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Were you here alone?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think so. I don't know. I don't remember anything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Track my finger. Do you know what day it is?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh... No, what day is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's Sunday. What's the last thing that you remember?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was in my apartment. I talked to you on the phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That was Friday.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been here since Friday?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, but you packed a bag. There's a change of clothes in there. Do you feel any pain? Did you receive a blow to your head?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you take anything, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you sure you didn't cut yourself?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's your weapon?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two rounds have been fired.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't remember that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I need to get you to a hospital. You have to be examined by a neurologist. You have had a serious cerebral event. It could be a viral infection, or possibly the early stages of encephalitis.

speaker: MULDER
line: If there was a crime committed, I need to know what happened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the first thing that you need to do, is to take care of yourself. Mulder, listen to me. We are going to figure this out, but first, we have to determine the cause. You cannot take something like this lightly. If this is an aneurysm, it could drop you in a second.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are these your keys?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You checked in alone around noon on Saturday. The manager's got no record of any phone calls made from the room. No visitors.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then, how did I get here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You drove. He's got a license number of a car registered. Do you have those keys you found in your room?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not my car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's blood on the steering wheel, Mulder. Car's registered under a David Cassandra. The address is right here in Providence.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's Amy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's what I'm gonna find out, Mulder, but first, I'm checking you out, because you have no business even walking around here.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, Scully. If I've shot someone, if my weapon's been used in a crime, I need to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You are taking a big risk, Mulder. I feel strongly about this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know you do, but it's my risk.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Can I help you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you Amy?

speaker: WOMAN
line: No, she's not here right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this David Cassandra's house?

speaker: WOMAN
line: This is Dave and Amy's house.

speaker: MULDER
line: And who are you?

speaker: WOMAN
line: I'm the housekeeper. Who are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're with the FBI.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Why do you have Amy's keys? Is something the matter?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Possibly. Is Amy or David reachable in anyway?

speaker: WOMAN
line: They're out right now. I don't know where they are.

speaker: MULDER
line: That, uh, painting... behind you. Uh... do you think I could take a look at it?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who painted this?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Amy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what's up?

speaker: MULDER
line: I know this house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. I've seen it before. Does this house have any special meaning to Amy or David?

speaker: WOMAN
line: I know it's her favorite subject. It's the house that she grew up in. Actually, it's all she paints.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been to that house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but I've been there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know anything else about this house?

speaker: WOMAN
line: I know it's out in Chepachet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's that?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's about 20 miles from here, on route eight. My parents had a summer house out there when I was a kid, in Rhode Island.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you've been here, Mulder I don't think it was any time recently. The place looks abandoned and completely overgrown. Mulder? Mulder?! Do you hear me? Mulder? Mulder?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: How can you do this to our family?!

speaker: MR. MULDER
line: I'm not doing it! It's not just me. These orders are coming down from...

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: You're a little spy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder, can you hear me? What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. It just hit me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You fell to your knees and you grabbed your head, like you were in terrible pain. You were completely non-responsive. Do you remember any of that?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I remember what I saw.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean, what you saw?

speaker: MULDER
line: I had a very vivid flashback to my childhood. Except, I was there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you remember anything else?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, just that it was very real.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your heart is racing.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you think it was?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was some kind of a seizure. Some kind of acute physiological disturbance. I couldn't tell if you lost consciousness but, it was definitely some kind of clonic event. Kind of an electrical storm in the brain.

speaker: MULDER
line: Brought on by what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's what a specialist is going to have to tell you, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I feel really good right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you are not really good.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I've been here before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What, in your childhood?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think anybody's lived here in a long time.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to check upstairs.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. There's a gunshot wound to her heart. This must be Amy Cassandra. And her husband.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They'd like to ask you some questions. I told them about your condition. You don't have to speak to them if you don't want to.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean, not without my attorney present?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I refuse to believe that you had any part in this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I had those people's blood on shirt, Scully. I was missing for two days. I have no recollection of my actions during those two days. There were two rounds discharged from my gun. I had the keys to this house, the keys to their car. Do the words "Orenthal James Simpson" mean anything to you?

speaker: CURTIS
line: How you feeling, agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm a little confused.

speaker: CURTIS
line: Your partner says you're suffering from some kind of a seizure, that you had one right here in the yard. What brought you to this house, agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. I, uh... I think I may have come here as a kid.

speaker: CURTIS
line: You think?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, my parents had a summer house in Quonochontaug, so...

speaker: CURTIS
line: But you don't know anything about David or Amy Cassandra, the victims?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't ever remember meeting them, no.

speaker: CURTIS
line: So what you're saying, then, is--the first time you saw them was when you walked into this house, using their keys, and you found them there on the floor.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what I'm saying.

speaker: CURTIS
line: We got plenty of prints in that house--some with blood on them. Now, we're going to run those prints, agent Mulder. Is that the story you want to stick with?

speaker: MULDER
line: For now.

speaker: CURTIS
line: Would you like to come down to the station, and elaborate on that statement?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder's not going anywhere but to a hospital.

speaker: CURTIS
line: Okay. But we're all going down there together. Agent Mulder, I'd like you to ride with us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'd advise you not to say anything more--not until I take a look at those bodies and the forensics reports.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you see this? puncture wound.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you mind?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not sure. Do you have a magnifying glass? Thanks. I just want to make sure that in addition to the autopsy, you also do a craniotomy and a histological examination.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I think it is, too, but what I'm more interested in right now is why they died.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's that?

speaker: CURTIS
line: Have you jogged your memory at all, agent Mulder? You wanna change your story?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Why?

speaker: CURTIS
line: Because I have evidence here that contradicts what it is you've told us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I haven't really told you anything.

speaker: CURTIS
line: You told us you haven't been to that house since your childhood, and you didn't know Amy or David Cassandra.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you're telling me what's in that bag is evidence that I'm a liar?

speaker: CURTIS
line: I'm not saying you're a liar, agent Mulder. I would like to believe that this memory lapse was real, and that you murdered these two people in some fit of blind insanity.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's in the bag?

speaker: CURTIS
line: It isn't your gun... which in our preliminary forensics analysis seems to be the murder weapon. Judging from the slugs we pulled from the floor and the wall, the execution-style point-blank range. Is any of this coming back to you, agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Can I see what's in the bag now?

speaker: CURTIS
line: Be my guest. There are two blood types on that shirt, agent Mulder--one matching Amy Cassandra's, the other matching David Cassandra's. Is that your shirt, agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: CURTIS
line: Can you explain to me how the blood of two people you claim not to know got onto your shirt?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. What about the prints... in the house? Were they my prints? Look, you're not going to get a confession out of me, because I can't answer your questions, because I don't remember.

speaker: CURTIS
line: You have the right to remain silent. If you give up the right to remain silent, anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law. You have the right to speak with an attorney, and have an attorney present during questioning. If you so desire and cannot afford one, an attorney will be appointed for you without charge before questioning. You understand each of the rights I have explained to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. I'm going to get you out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're a doctor, not a lawyer, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you make a confession?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Only to my own ignorance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Detective Curtis, before you go through all that trouble, I need you to consider evidence that I think casts doubt on agent Mulder's involvement in this crime.

speaker: CURTIS
line: What kind of evidence?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Medical evidence. The toxicology report on Amy Cassandra indicates there was a rapid-acting anesthetic called Ketamine in her system.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ketamine? That's a veterinary drug, isn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Typically, but when ingested by a person, it can cause hallucinations.

speaker: CURTIS
line: So?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, I went down to the hospital to go over agent Mulder's medical charts and his blood work, and there are traces of the same drug in his system.

speaker: MULDER
line: How would that get there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Probably injected--there was a bruise from an injection on Amy Cassandra's right hip. Now, I think if you were examined again--that we would find a corresponding puncture.

speaker: CURTIS
line: Given by whom?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, but the presence of such a powerful drug could explain his memory loss or the blackouts.

speaker: CURTIS
line: Given the weight of all the other evidence... I think that's all it explains.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully... you don't have to do this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you have to help me out. There is nothing here that points directly to your guilt. I mean, unless somebody can show me with absolute certainty that you were holding the weapon that killed those two people, the rest of the narrative is far too convenient and suspect. The drug in your system already suggests other explanations.

speaker: MULDER
line: What? That I was partying with a few senior citizens?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're jailing an innocent man.

speaker: CURTIS
line: Yeah, well, this way he won't get lost for two days and do something else he won't remember.

speaker: MAN
line: Shot fired!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm a doctor. Somebody call the paramedics. He's dead. I need to speak with detective Curtis right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did this officer have a history of depression or mental illness?

speaker: CURTIS
line: He'd been remanded from his beat assignment to a desk job a year ago. His former partner had complained on a number of occasions about his tendency toward extreme irritability, and confabulation of the truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you mean?

speaker: CURTIS
line: The man we're talking about had become something of a joke on the force, one of those guys who believes in... you know, extraterrestrials? Stuff like that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you see these photos?

speaker: CURTIS
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Does this mean anything to you?

speaker: CURTIS
line: Should it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I think that it speaks to a pronounced mental illness. The compulsive and repetitive act of removing his own image from these photos leads me to believe that he not only believed these stories, but was traumatized by them.

speaker: CURTIS
line: I thought you told me this was going to help explain something about your partner's crime. What's that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Amy Cassandra. Both your officer and Amy Cassandra had identical puncture wounds at the top of the frontal lobe. Now, in her autopsy, Amy Cassandra's was a deep puncture through the cranium to the dura matter.

speaker: CURTIS
line: And my officer had the same thing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. I think your officer knew of Amy Cassandra, and somehow his suicide is linked to her death, which leads me to believe that what we're dealing with here is not murder. It's something else. It's possibly even a suicide pact.

speaker: CURTIS
line: You're going to have to prove that to me.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Not Samantha! Not Samantha! No! My baby!

speaker: MULDER
line: Guard! Guard! I need to talk to someone! Guard!

speaker: CURTIS
line: According to the corrections officer, agent Mulder kept everybody awake last night. He was demanding to talk to you. He finally shut up about an hour ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he say about what?

speaker: CURTIS
line: I think your partner's memories are coming back to him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need to talk to him alone, if you don't mind. I heard you didn't get much sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't kill those people, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know that, and I think I've gathered enough proof and evidence of your innocence to get you out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: From where?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The forensics reports. The, uh, the shirt that you were wearing did have the victims' blood on it, but the blood-spatter pattern doesn't match the point-of-entry detail. In fact, detective Curtis and his team have been able to put together enough contradictory evidence to make a statement to the press saying that the Cassandras' death was as a result of a murder-suicide.

speaker: MULDER
line: But I was there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: And I still don't remember why.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I have an idea about that, too. Amy Cassandra believed that she was an alien abductee.

speaker: MULDER
line: And I contacted her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes... apparently. According to an article I read on Amy, she had begun psychiatric treatment that was effectively recovering her past. The repetitive behavior exhibited in those paintings that we saw, was an expression of that treatment.

speaker: MULDER
line: But why shoot herself and her husband?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't say definitively, but judging from an almost identical suicide of a police officer who was receiving the same psychiatric care, I believe that the victims were suffering from something called Waxman-Geschwind syndrome, the symptoms of which are trance-like states, leading to vivid dreams about the past-- dreams that are more detailed than the conscious mind can recall. It's also called Dostoyevsky syndrome because the Russian novelist was suffering from it, too.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was I doing there, Scully, and why didn't I do anything to stop it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't explain that. I've arranged for your arraignment in one hour. I think that by then, detective Curtis and I will have gathered enough forensics data that you'll be released.

speaker: MULDER
line: I still need to know why, though.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is the office of the psychologist that treated Amy Cassandra. Have you been here before?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but we found my car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's been here for a few days.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was the name of that psychologist?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: Hello.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Goldstein? My name is Fox Mulder. Have we met?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: I don't believe so. My receptionist says you're from the FBI?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. We're investigating the deaths of Amy and David Cassandra. We understand that Amy was a patient of yours.

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: Yes. Please, sit down. I was very upset to learn about Amy. She was a troubled woman who'd struggled through an unfortunate period of darkness in her life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you referring to her belief that she was an abductee?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: This term "alien abductee..." Although I recognize there is an associated syndrome, and a rather remarkable collection of shared experiences for those who believe in the phenomena, my treatment of Amy was simply an aggressive method to access buried or repressed memories.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you mean, "aggressive"?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: I use a method of therapy that simulates an electrical impulse in the brain, using light and sound.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you also use this treatment on a police officer named Michael Fazekas?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: Yes. Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Fazekas shot himself in the head last night.

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: Oh, my god.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is this an accepted form of medical treatment?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: It's unconventional, but it's not invasive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you familiar with Waxman-Geschwind syndrome?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you know Amy Cassandra suffered from it?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: Waxman-Geschwind...if you know anything about it, it is not necessarily a destructive condition. In fact, Amy, after undergoing treatment, experienced periods of extreme happiness and creativity.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you had no idea--you had no indication she might have taken her own life?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: No! Of course not. I have been in practice for over 40 years. I have a very good ethical and professional reputation, if you'd care to check.

speaker: MULDER
line: That won't be necessary.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know what you do.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have been here before. I met Dr. Goldstein with Amy Cassandra.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This man is lying about more than that. I think that he administered the Ketamine to Amy and to you. I think that you were treated by him, and I think that your blackouts--these seizures--are a result of that.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you're right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would you do that, Mulder? Why would you undergo something as crazy and dangerous as this? Mulder? Mulder! Mulder?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: My baby!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm fine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I am not going to take that for an answer. You do not belong at work. You need to be somewhere where you can be monitored. You are a danger to yourself, and a danger to me. Are you hearing me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me the car keys.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, you're not driving. You're not doing anything until these symptoms go away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I don't want these symptoms to go away. Whatever's happening to me, whatever treatment I've received, is allowing me to go back into my unconscious. The truth is in there, recorded, and I've gotten access to it. What happened to my sister--the reason she was taken--is becoming clear to me, and I need to know that. Now give me the keys.

speaker: SCULLY
line: To go where?

speaker: MULDER
line: To my mother's, in Greenwich.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay... but I'm driving.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to speak to you.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: What's happened, Fox? Why have you come here?

speaker: MULDER
line: You've kept things from me. You've kept secrets from me.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: What's the matter with him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's undergone a treatment. He believes it's helped him to remember things.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Remember what?

speaker: MULDER
line: You told me that, when they took Samantha, it was because you had to make a choice, but that's not how it happened. It wasn't your choice to make.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: What do you want to hear from me?

speaker: MULDER
line: I wanna know what happened that night on Quonochontaug, and I need to speak to you privately. You had some kind of relationship with him.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: You know who. The man who worked with my father, the man who came to you that night when I was 12, and forced you to choose Samantha.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: No, Fox...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes! You betrayed my father, your husband.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Never!

speaker: MULDER
line: How far back did it go?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: How dare you! How dare you come here and accuse me!?

speaker: MULDER
line: Who is my father?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: What do you want, to kill him again?!

speaker: MULDER
line: Just answer the question, mom. Just answer the question!

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: I am your mother, and I will not tolerate any more of your questions. You're bleeding, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you do to me?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: I told you...

speaker: MULDER
line: You treated me. I asked you to treat me to recover my past.

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: I did nothing wrong.

speaker: MULDER
line: You put a hole in my head.

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: A slight electrical stimulation.

speaker: MULDER
line: It triggered my memory.

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: Yes, as you had hoped.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now I want you to finish the job. Let's do it. I wanna remember.

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: Little spy.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Fox...

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Fox...

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: Little spy.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Fox!

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Not Samantha! Not Samantha!

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Fox!

speaker: CURTIS
line: Dr. Charles Goldstein? Dr. Goldstein, you're under arrest. Please, keep your hands where they are. Bag those gloves as evidence. Someone, read him his rights. Where is he? Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Mulder?

speaker: CURTIS
line: He's not here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you ask Dr. Goldstein?

speaker: CURTIS
line: Goldstein wouldn't say one way or the other.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop that car! Hey! Open the back door. What did you do to him? Look, I know he came back here. This is the only place he would have gone. Did you treat him? Damn it! Answer me!

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he now?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: I don't know where he went.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What was the last thing he said to you?

speaker: GOLDSTEIN
line: He said he was going to exorcise his demons.

speaker: IMHOF
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: IMHOF
line: Frank Imhof.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is he in there?

speaker: IMHOF
line: Saw a light go on a couple of minutes ago. Got to be somebody in there. We got here as soon as you called.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right... that man in there is armed. He is a federal officer in dire need of medical attention. He is not himself. Now, I'm going in there. If at any time he should flee that house, you need to tell your officers not to shoot.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Leave me alone, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, leave me alone.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Not Samantha! Not Samantha!

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Fox!

speaker: MULDER
line: It's... all falling into place.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, Put down the gun.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Don't try to stop me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Please, Mulder...

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Fox...

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: No! She's my baby!

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I'm afraid, Fox. I'm afraid.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get away!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you going to shoot me, Mulder? Is that how much this means to you? Mulder, listen to me. You have been given a powerful hallucinogen. You don't know that these memories are yours. This is not the way to the truth, Mulder. You've got to trust me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Shut up!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Put down the gun. Let it go.

speaker: IMHOF
line: We got shots fired. Move! to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Although cleared of any wrongdoing in the deaths of Amy and David Cassandra, agent Mulder still has no recollection of the events that led to their deaths. His seizures have subsided, with no evidence of permanent cerebral damage, but I'm concerned that this experience will have a lasting effect. Agent Mulder undertook this treatment hoping to lay claim to his past--that by retrieving memories lost to him, he might finally understand the path he's on, but if that knowledge remains elusive, and if it's only by knowing where he's been that he can hope to understand where he's going, then I fear agent Mulder may lose his course, and the truths he's seeking, from his childhood, will continue to evade him...driving him more dangerously forward in impossible pursuit.
